intro: Pseudolysimachion pusanensis, commonly known as the Korean false lysimachia, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically features broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
